recipes.name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Cook chicken in tandoor or oven

recipes.name: Vada
instructions: Mix in chilies, ginger, and curry leaves
Shape into vadas and deep fry
Serve hot with chutney or sambar

recipes.name: Rava Upma
instructions: Sauté mustard seeds, chilies, and curry leaves
Add water and bring to boil
Mix in semolina and cook until thickened

recipes.name: Parotta
instructions: Knead flour with water and salt
Cook on a griddle until golden brown

recipes.name: Chapathi
instructions: Knead flour with water and salt
Cook on a hot griddle until golden brown

recipes.name: Masala Puri
instructions: Boil dried green peas and potatoes
Prepare a spicy masala by cooking onions and tomatoes
Crush puris and layer with masala
Drizzle green chutney, tamarind chutney, and chaat masala
Garnish with sev and coriander leaves

recipes.name: Bhel Puri
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl

recipes.name: Chikki
instructions: Spread on a greased surface and flatten

recipes.name: Rasgulla
instructions: Knead chhena into a smooth dough

recipes.name: Cauliflower Gobi
instructions: Add cauliflower and cook until tender
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve

recipes.name: Masala Vada curry
instructions: Prepare masala vada batter and deep fry
Add fried vadas to gravy and simmer
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve

recipes.name: Fish curry
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt
Add fish pieces and cook until tender

recipes.name: Fish Fry
instructions: Heat oil and shallow fry until crispy

recipes.name: Mutton Gravy
instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes in oil
Add mutton and cook until tender
Garnish and serve with rice or roti

recipes.name: Mutton Fry
instructions: Cook until soft and fry with onions

recipes.name: Tomato Dal
instructions: Temper with mustard seeds and garlic

recipes.name: Aloo Koorma
instructions: Cook potatoes and prepare coconut paste
Make rich gravy and simmer with potatoes
Serve hot with roti or rice

recipes.name: Sweet Pongal
instructions: Cook rice and moong dal together
Melt jaggery and mix with cooked rice
Add ghee, cashews, raisins, and cardamom

recipes.name: Puran Poli
instructions: Cook chana dal and mix with jaggery
Make small balls and stuff with sweet filling
Roll out and cook on a griddle with ghee

recipes.name: Modak
instructions: Make dough using rice flour and hot water
Shape into dumplings and steam cook

recipes.name: Undrallu
instructions: Boil water and add rice rava
Shape into small balls and serve

recipes.name: Chegodilu
instructions: Mix rice flour with spices and butter

recipes.name: Murukku
instructions: Prepare dough with rice and urad dal flour

recipes.name: Kova
instructions: Shape into small pieces and cool

recipes.name: Doodh Peda
instructions: Shape into small pedas and let cool

recipes.name: Banana Chips
instructions: Peel and slice raw bananas thinly.
Heat coconut oil and deep fry slices until crispy.
Drain excess oil and sprinkle salt and turmeric powder.
Let cool and store in an airtight container.

recipes.name: Dal Pongal
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic.
Cook rice and dal together until soft.
In ghee, fry black pepper, cumin seeds, ginger, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to the cooked rice and dal mixture.
Garnish with fried cashews and serve hot.

recipes.name: Boondi Laddu
instructions: Prepare a batter with gram flour and water.
Fry small drops of batter in hot oil to make boondi.
Make sugar syrup and mix with boondi.
Add cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins.
Shape into laddus and let them set.

recipes.name: Prawn Curry
instructions: Clean and marinate prawns with turmeric and salt.
Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger in oil until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add prawns, coconut milk, and spices, then simmer until prawns are cooked.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Prawn Fry
instructions: Marinate prawns with garlic, ginger, chili powder, turmeric, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan and fry prawns until crispy.
Drain excess oil and serve hot.

recipes.name: Snake Gourd Curry
instructions: Slice the snake gourd into thin pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Add chopped garlic, onions, and curry leaves, sauté until onions turn golden.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add the snake gourd slices, chili powder, turmeric, and salt.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer until the curry thickens.
Serve hot with rice or roti.
